Uses of Class
entities.Entity

  • Packages that use Entity 
    Package Description
    entities  
    gui  

    • Uses of Entity in entities

      Subclasses of Entity in entities 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  Enemy
      The Enemy class represents an enemy that tries to attack the user
      class  GameCharacter
      An abstract class Game Character, which represents a character (an animate entity)
      class  User
      The User class is the representation of the player in which the user controls

    • Uses of Entity in gui

      Methods in gui that return Entity 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Entity Room.entityAt​(java.awt.Point location)
      Identifies and returns an Entity at a specified location, if it exists
      Entity Room.getDownEntity​(java.awt.Point p)
      Retrieves and returns an entity, if it exists, that is located below a given location, otherwise, return null
      Entity Room.getLeftEntity​(java.awt.Point p)
      Retrieves and returns an entity, if it exists, that is located to the left of a given location, otherwise, return null
      Entity Room.getRightEntity​(java.awt.Point p)
      Retrieves and returns an entity, if it exists, that is located to the right of a given location, otherwise, return null
      Entity Room.getUpEntity​(java.awt.Point p)
      Retrieves and returns an entity, if it exists, that is located above a given location, otherwise, return null
      Methods in gui with parameters of type Entity 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void Room.addEntity​(Entity entity)
      Adds an entity to the room and allow it to be displayed to the screen while also adding it to the ArrayList of entities
      void Room.kill​(Entity entity)
      "Kills" a given entity by removing it from the room and setting its alive status to false (If it is a character)
      void Room.move​(Entity entity, java.awt.Point p)
      Moves a given entity from its original location to a specified location
      void Room.redraw​(Entity entity, javax.swing.ImageIcon img)
      Redraws a given entity to an alternate image
      void Room.redraw​(Entity entity, javax.swing.ImageIcon img, int offx, int offy)
      Redraws a given entity to an alternate image accordingly to the x and y offset
      void Room.removeEntity​(Entity entity)
      Removes a given entity from the room and the ArrayList of entities
